bwwExcerpt: The actors who kept the production going, half-jokingly begging for food from their audiences in lieu of ticket sales, are the heroes here - particularly when Asch, after returning to Poland and witnessing the horrors there, and after futilely attempting to waken the U.S. government into action, turns reclusive. So, what shocks us now? The idea of a religious Jewish man running a brothel? A prostitute idealized? The sight of lesbians kissing? Or the fact that people focused on those things while
